metadata.title: UK Government GHG Conversion Factors 2025 - Major Changes

criteria.description: Changes greater than 5% for Scope 1&2, greater than 10% for Scope 3

uk_electricity.reason: Decrease primarily due to less natural gas use in power stations and increase in net imports of electricity
uk_electricity.impact: Major reduction in carbon intensity of UK grid electricity

business_travel_air.reason: COVID-19 recovery - load factors have returned to normal from unusually low 2021 levels
business_travel_air.impact: Significant reduction in aviation emission factors per passenger.km

electric_vehicles.reason: Combination of UK electricity grid improvement and more efficient new vehicle registrations

major_changes.reason: Changes apply only to CH4 factor with N2O remaining the same; due to more accurate data on emissions from power stations from Pollutant Inventory for straw fired power stations
Sports PHEV direct emissions increased because of a new car model with relatively higher direct emissions than previous Sports PHEV models in the fleet with high 2023 registrations
Decrease primarily due to less natural gas use in power stations and increase in net imports of electricity
WTT EFs reported under RTFO are very specific to feedstock, source, and production conditions. Mix changes year-on-year cause significant factor changes
2025 figures reflect latest data from water companies showing considerable interannual variation
Last update was 2023 using COVID-impacted 2021 data with unusually low load factors. Load factors have now returned to normal, reducing emissions per passenger.km
COVID recovery in load factors plus improvements in aviation model with more recent data replacing 2012 CAA data

major_changes.subcategory: Forecourt fuels containing biofuel - Diesel (average biofuel blend)
major_changes.reason: Genuine trend in RTFO stats showing decreased use of biofuels this year. Percentage distorted by small factor values and rounding

technical_notes.covid_recovery_impact: Many transport-related factors show improvement due to load factor recovery from COVID-19 impact in 2021 data
technical_notes.electricity_decarbonization: UK electricity grid continues to decarbonize with less natural gas and more renewables/imports
technical_notes.bioenergy_variability: Bioenergy factors show high year-over-year variation due to changing feedstock mix and production methods
technical_notes.rounding_effects: Some percentage changes appear large due to small absolute values and rounding in government data
